alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 11 at 11:09PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lee, southeastern St. Francis, southwestern Crittenden, DeSoto, northeastern Tunica and southwestern Shelby Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1108 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hughes, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Olive Branch, West Memphis, Horn Lake, Hernando, Hughes, T O Fuller State Park, Memphis, Walls, Edmondson, Horseshoe Lake, Anthonyville, Lake Cormorant, Southwest Memphis, Eudora, Simsboro, Whitehaven, Pinckney, Lynchburg and Southeast Memphis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for eastern Arkansas...northwestern Mississippi...and western Tennessee.
